description:
The NSIDC Distributed Active Archive Center (DAAC) processes, archives, documents, and distributes data from NASA's past and current Earth Observing System (EOS) satellites and field measurement programs. The NSIDC DAAC focuses on the study of the cryosphere.
The NSIDC DAAC is one of NASA's Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS) Data Centers.
descriptionCn:
NSIDC 分布式主动存档中心 (DAAC) 处理、存档、记录和分发来自 NASA 过去和当前地球观测系统 (EOS) 卫星和现场测量项目的数据。 NSIDC DAAC 专注于冰冻圈研究。
NSIDC DAAC 是 NASA 地球观测系统数据和信息系统 (EOSDIS) 数据中心之一。

repositoryName: Advanced Cooperative Arctic Data and Information Service
repositoryNameCn: 先进的北极合作数据和信息服务
institutions: National Science Foundation(United States); National Snow and Ice Data Center(United States); University Corporation for Atmospheric Research(United States); University Corporation for Atmospheric Research, National Center for Atmospheric Research(United States); University Corporation for Atmospheric Research, UNIDATA(United States)

contentTypes: Archived data; Raw data; Scientific and statistical data formats
contentTypesCn: 存档数据; 原始数据; 科学和统计数据格式
description:
>>>>!!!<<<<As of March 28, 2016, the 'NSF Arctic Data Center' will serve as the current repository for NSF-funded Arctic data. The ACADIS Gateway http://www.aoncadis.org is no longer accepting data submissions. All data and metadata in the ACADIS system have been transferred to the NSF Arctic Data Center system. There is no need for you to resubmit existing data. >>>>!!!<<<<
ACADIS is a repository for Arctic research data to provide data archival, preservation and access for all projects funded by NSF's Arctic Science Program (ARC). Data include long-term observational timeseries, local, regional, and system-scale research from many diverse domains. The Advanced Cooperative Arctic Data and Information Service (ACADIS) program includes data management services.
descriptionCn:
>>>>!!!<<<<自 2016 年 3 月 28 日起，“NSF 北极数据中心”将作为 NSF 资助的北极数据的当前存储库。 ACADIS 网关 http://www.aoncadis.org 不再接受数据提交。 ACADIS系统中的所有数据和元数据均已转移至NSF北极数据中心系统。您无需重新提交现有数据。 >>>>!!!<<<<
ACADIS 是北极研究数据的存储库，为 NSF 北极科学计划 (ARC) 资助的所有项目提供数据存档、保存和访问。数据包括来自许多不同领域的长期观测时间序列、本地、区域和系统规模的研究。高级合作北极数据和信息服务（ACADIS）计划包括数据管理服务。

description: Until 2014 housed in the library of the Scott Polar Research Institute, the WDC for Glaciology, Cambridge, maintains a particularly comprehensive collection of publications covering all aspects of snow and ice worldwide. Glaciological literature has been systematically collected and catalogued at the Scott Polar Research Institute since 1920. The SPRI Picture Library houses one of the world's most comprehensive collections of historical photographs of the Polar Regions
descriptionCn: 直到 2014 年，剑桥 WDC 冰川学图书馆一直位于斯科特极地研究所的图书馆，保存着涵盖全球冰雪各个方面的特别全面的出版物。自 1920 年以来，斯科特极地研究所一直在系统地收集和编目冰川学文献。SPRI 图片图书馆拥有世界上最全面的极地历史照片收藏之一

institutions: Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Mountain Hazards and Environment(China); Chinese Academy of Sciences, Northwest Institute of Eco-Environment and Resources(China); Chinese Academy of Sciences, Qinghai Salt Lake Research Institute(China); Chinese Academy of Sciences, Xinjiang Institute of Ecology and Geography(China)

description: The National Cryosphere Desert Data Center (hereinafter referred to as NCDC) is supported by the Institute of environment and Engineering in the cold and dry areas of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, in cooperation with Xinjiang Institute of ecology and geography of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, Chengdu Institute of mountain land disaster and environment of the Ministry of water resources of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, Qinghai Salt Lake Research Institute of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and Qinghai Gao of the Chinese Academy of Sciences The Institute of protobiology and other units were jointly established. The supporting units of glacier permafrost desert data center have formed a scientific research and support system of seven research laboratories and three research systems, highlighting the research characteristics of glacier, permafrost, desert, atmosphere, water and soil, ecology, environment, resources, engineering and sustainable development in the dry areas of cold regions.
descriptionCn: 国家冰冻圈沙漠数据中心（以下简称NCDC）由中国科学院寒旱区环境与工程研究所支持，中国科学院新疆生态与地理研究所合作、中国科学院水利部成都山地灾害与环境研究所、中国科学院青海盐湖研究所和中国科学院青海高原生生物研究所等单位共同成立。冰川多年冻土数据中心依托单位形成了七个研究实验室、三个研究系统的科研支撑体系，突出冰川、多年冻土、沙漠、大气、水土、生态、环境、资源、工程等领域的研究特色寒地干旱地区可持续发展。

description: The Polar Data Center (PDC) manages the Science Database among other repositories for Japanese polar research.  The Science Database is the destination repository for all Japanese Antarctic Research Expedition (JARE) data as well as the Japanese contribution to the International Polar Year (IPY) 2007-2008. Metadata are in English and Japanese, and metadata records are shared with the Global Change Master Directory.

repositoryNameCn: 中分辨率成像光谱仪
institutions: NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center(United States); National Aeronautics and Space Administration(United States); National Snow and Ice Data Center(United States); U. S. Geological Survey EROS Data Center(United States)
institutionsCn: 美国宇航局戈达德太空飞行中心(美国); 国家航空和航天局(美国); 国家冰雪数据中心(美国); 美国地质调查局 EROS 数据中心(美国)
contentTypes: Images; Raw data; Software applications; Structured graphics; other
contentTypesCn: 图片; 原始数据; 软件应用; 结构化图形; 其他
description: MODIS (or Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) is a key instrument aboard the Terra (originally known as EOS AM-1) and Aqua (originally known as EOS PM-1) satellites. Terra's orbit around the Earth is timed so that it passes from north to south across the equator in the morning, while Aqua passes south to north over the equator in the afternoon. Terra MODIS and Aqua MODIS are viewing the entire Earth's surface every 1 to 2 days, acquiring data in 36 spectral bands, or groups of wavelengths (see MODIS Technical Specifications). These data will improve our understanding of global dynamics and processes occurring on the land, in the oceans, and in the lower atmosphere. MODIS is playing a vital role in the development of validated, global, interactive Earth system models able to predict global change accurately enough to assist policy makers in making sound decisions concerning the protection of our environment.
descriptionCn: MODIS（或中分辨率成像光谱仪）是 Terra（最初称为 EOS AM-1）和 Aqua（最初称为 EOS PM-1）卫星上的关键仪器。 Terra 围绕地球的轨道是经过定时的，以便它在早上从北向南穿过赤道，而 Aqua 在下午从南向北穿过赤道。 Terra MODIS 和 Aqua MODIS 每 1 到 2 天观察一次整个地球表面，获取 36 个光谱带或波长组的数据（请参阅 MODIS 技术规格）。这些数据将增进我们对陆地、海洋和低层大气中发生的全球动态和过程的理解。 MODIS 在开发经过验证的全球交互式地球系统模型方面发挥着至关重要的作用，该模型能够足够准确地预测全球变化，以帮助政策制定者就环境保护做出明智的决策。

repositoryNameCn: 综合气候数据中心
institutions: Universität Hamburg, Center for Earth System Research and Sustainability, Integrated Climate Data Center(Germany)
institutionsCn: 汉堡大学，地球系统研究和可持续发展中心，综合气候数据中心(德国)

description: The CliSAP-Integrated Climate Data Center (ICDC) allows easy access to climate relevant data from satellite remote sensing and in situ and other measurements in Earth System Sciences. These data are important to determine the status and the changes in the climate system. Additionally some relevant re-analysis data are included, which are modeled on the basis of observational data. ICDC cooperates with the "Zentrum für Nachhaltiges Forschungsdatenmanagement "https://www.fdr.uni-hamburg.de/ to publish observational data with a doi.
descriptionCn: CliSAP 综合气候数据中心 (ICDC) 可以轻松访问来自卫星遥感和原位以及地球系统科学中的其他测量的气候相关数据。这些数据对于确定气候系统的状况和变化非常重要。此外还包括一些相关的再分析数据，这些数据是根据观测数据建模的。 ICDC 与“Zentrum für Nachhaltiges Forschungsdatenmanagement”合作 https://www.fdr.uni-hamburg.de/ 通过 doi 发布观测数据。

description:
US Department of Energy’s Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) Data Center is a long-term archive and distribution facility for various ground-based, aerial and model data products in support of atmospheric and climate research. ARM facility currently operates over 400 instruments at various observatories (https://www.arm.gov/capabilities/observatories/). 
ARM Data Center (ADC) Archive currently holds over 11,000 data products with a total holding of over 3 petabytes of data that dates back to 1993, these include data from instruments, value added products, model outputs, field campaign and PI contributed data. The data center archive also includes data collected by ARM from related program (e.g., external data such as NASA satellite).
descriptionCn:
美国能源部的大气辐射测量 (ARM) 数据中心是一个长期存档和分发各种地面、航空和模型数据产品的设施，以支持大气和气候研究。 ARM 设施目前在各个天文台运行着 400 多台仪器 (https://www.arm.gov/capability/observatories/)。
ARM 数据中心 (ADC) 档案目前拥有 11,000 多个数据产品，总存储量超过 3 PB，可追溯到 1993 年，其中包括来自仪器、增值产品、模型输出、现场活动和 PI 贡献数据的数据。数据中心档案还包括 ARM 从相关程序收集的数据（例如 NASA 卫星等外部数据）。

repositoryName: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information -  Paleoclimatology Data
repositoryNameCn: NOAA 国家环境信息中心 - 古气候数据
institutions: National Centers for Environmental Information(United States); National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration(United States)
institutionsCn: 国家环境信息中心(美国); 国家海洋和大气管理局(美国)
contentTypes: Images; Scientific and statistical data formats; Standard office documents; Structured text; other
contentTypesCn: 图片; 科学和统计数据格式; 标准办公文件; 结构化文本; 其他
description:
Paleoclimatology data are derived from natural sources such as tree rings, ice cores, corals, and ocean and lake sediments. These proxy climate data extend the archive of weather and climate information hundreds to millions of years. The data include geophysical or biological measurement time series and some reconstructed climate variables such as temperature and precipitation.
NCEI provides the paleoclimatology data and information scientists need to understand natural climate variability and future climate change. We also operate the World Data Center for Paleoclimatology, which archives and distributes data contributed by scientists around the world.
descriptionCn:
古气候学数据来源于树木年轮、冰芯、珊瑚以及海洋和湖泊沉积物等自然资源。这些代理气候数据将天气和气候信息的档案延伸了数百年至数百万年。这些数据包括地球物理或生物测量时间序列以及一些重建的气候变量，例如温度和降水。
NCEI 提供科学家了解自然气候变率和未来气候变化所需的古气候学数据和信息。我们还运营着世界古气候学数据中心，该中心存档和分发世界各地科学家贡献的数据。

description:
On February 24, 2000, Terra began collecting what will ultimately become a new, 15-year global data set on which to base scientific investigations about our complex home planet. Together with the entire fleet of EOS spacecraft, Terra is helping scientists unravel the mysteries of climate and environmental change. TERRA's data collection instruments include:  
Advanced Spaceborne Thermal Emission and Reflection Radiometer (ASTER), 
Clouds and the Earth's Radiant Energy System (CERES),  
Multi-angle Imaging Spectro-Radiometer (MISR), 
Moderate-resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS), 
Measurement of Pollution in the Troposphere (MOPITT)
descriptionCn:
2000 年 2 月 24 日，Terra 开始收集最终将成为一个新的 15 年全球数据集，以此为基础对我们复杂的家园星球进行科学研究。 Terra 与整个 EOS 航天器舰队一起帮助科学家揭开气候和环境变化的谜团。 TERRA 的数据采集仪器包括：
先进星载热发射和反射辐射计（ASTER），
云和地球辐射能系统（CERES），
多角度成像光谱辐射计 (MISR)，
中分辨率成像光谱仪 (MODIS)，
对流层污染测量 (MOPITT)

description: Climate Data Record (CDR) is a time series of measurements of sufficient length, consistency and continuity to determine climate variability and change. The fundamental CDRs include sensor data, such as calibrated radiances and brightness temperatures, that scientists have improved and quality-controlled along with the data used to calibrate them. The thematic CDRs include geophysical variables derived from the fundamental CDRs, such as sea surface temperature and sea ice concentration, and they are specific to various disciplines.
descriptionCn: 气候数据记录 (CDR) 是具有足够长度、一致性和连续性的测量时间序列，用于确定气候变率和变化。基本的 CDR 包括传感器数据，例如校准的辐射率和亮度温度，科学家们已经对这些数据以及用于校准它们的数据进行了改进和质量控制。主题 CDR 包括从基本 CDR 衍生的地球物理变量，例如海面温度和海冰浓度，并且它们特定于各个学科。

repositoryNameCn: 由 EOSDIS 提供支持的 Earthdata

description:
Earthdata powered by EOSDIS (Earth Observing System Data and Information System) is a key core capability in NASA’s Earth Science Data Systems Program. It provides end-to-end capabilities for managing NASA’s Earth science data from various sources – satellites, aircraft, field measurements, and various other programs. EOSDIS uses the metadata and service discovery tool Earthdata Search https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.  
The capabilities of EOSDIS constituting the EOSDIS Science Operations are managed by NASA's Earth Science Data and Information System (ESDIS) Project. The capabilities include: generation of higher level (Level 1-4) science data products for several satellite missions; archiving and distribution of data products from Earth observation satellite missions, as well as aircraft and field measurement campaigns. The EOSDIS science operations are performed within a distributed system of many interconnected nodes -  Science Investigator-led Processing Systems (SIPS), and distributed, discipline-specific, Earth science Distributed Active Archive Centers (DAACs) with specific responsibilities for production, archiving, and distribution of Earth science data products. The DAACs serve a large and diverse user community by providing capabilities to search and access science data products and specialized services.
descriptionCn:
由 EOSDIS（地球观测系统数据和信息系统）提供支持的 Earthdata 是 NASA 地球科学数据系统计划的关键核心功能。它提供端到端的功能，用于管理来自各种来源（卫星、飞机、现场测量和各种其他程序）的 NASA 地球科学数据。 EOSDIS 使用元数据和服务发现工具 Earthdata Search https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search。
构成 EOSDIS 科学运营的 EOSDIS 功能由 NASA 地球科学数据和信息系统 (ESDIS) 项目管理。这些功能包括：为多个卫星任务生成更高级别（1-4 级）科学数据产品；地球观测卫星任务以及飞机和现场测量活动的数据产品的归档和分发。 EOSDIS 科学操作是在由许多互连节点组成的分布式系统中执行的 - 科学研究者主导的处理系统 (SIPS) 和分布式、特定学科的地球科学分布式主动存档中心 (DAAC)，其具体负责生产、存档和存储。 distribution of Earth science data products. DAAC 通过提供搜索和访问科学数据产品和专业服务的功能，为庞大且多样化的用户社区提供服务。

repositoryNameCn: 美国南极计划数据中心

description: The U.S. Antarctic Program Data Center (USAP-DC) provides the central Project Catalog  for projects funded by the NSF for the U.S. Antarctic Program and  Data Repository for multi-disciplinary investigator research datasets derived from these projects. Services provided support investigators in documenting, preserving, and disseminating their research results. All data are openly accessible to the international community for browse, search, and data download. Datasets are registered in the Antarctic Master Directory to comply with the Antarctic Treaty.
descriptionCn: 美国南极计划数据中心 (USAP-DC) 为美国南极计划 NSF 资助的项目提供中央项目目录，并为从这些项目派生的多学科研究者研究数据集提供数据存储库。服务为研究人员记录、保存和传播他们的研究结果提供支持。所有数据均可向国际社会公开浏览、搜索和数据下载。数据集在南极主目录中注册，以遵守南极条约。

description: The Barrow area on the North Slope of Alaska is one of the most intensely sampled locations in the Arctic with research sites dating back to the 1940s. The Barrow Area Information Database (BAID) is a resource for learning about the types of data collection activities in the region. The BAID team collaborates with scientists and the local community to compile and share this information via online web mapping applications.
descriptionCn: 阿拉斯加北坡的巴罗地区是北极采样最密集的地区之一，研究地点的历史可以追溯到 20 世纪 40 年代。巴罗地区信息数据库 (BAID) 是一个用于了解该地区数据收集活动类型的资源。 BAID 团队与科学家和当地社区合作，通过在线网络地图应用程序编译和共享这些信息。

description:
The Physical Oceanography Distributed Active Archive Center (PO.DAAC) is an element of the Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS). The EOSDIS provides science data to a wide community of users for NASA's Science Mission Directorate. 
Since the launch of NASA's first ocean-observing satellite, Seasat, in 1978, PO.DAAC has become the premier data center for measurements focused on ocean surface topography (OST), sea surface temperature (SST), ocean winds, sea surface salinity (SSS), gravity, ocean circulation and sea ice.In addition to providing access to its data holdings, PO.DAAC acts as a gateway to data stored at other ocean and climate archives. This and other tools and services enable PO.DAAC to support a wide user community working in areas such as ocean and climate research, applied science and industry, natural resource management, policy making, and general public consumption.
descriptionCn:
物理海洋学分布式主动档案中心（PO.DAAC）是地球观测系统数据和信息系统（EOSDIS）的一个组成部分。 EOSDIS 为 NASA 科学任务理事会的广泛用户社区提供科学数据。
自 1978 年 NASA 发射第一颗海洋观测卫星 Seasat 以来，PO.DAAC 已成为主要测量海洋表面地形 (OST)、海面温度 (SST)、海洋风、海面盐度（ SSS）、重力、海洋环流和海冰。除了提供对其数据的访问之外，PO.DAAC 还充当存储在其他海洋和气候档案中的数据的网关。该工具和其他工具和服务使 PO.DAAC 能够支持海洋和气候研究、应用科学和工业、自然资源管理、政策制定和一般公共消费等领域的广泛用户社区。

repositoryNameCn: TerraSAR-X TOR
institutions: DLR(Germany); German Aerospace Center,  Terra SAR Science Service System(Germany); Helmholtz Centre Potsdam - GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences(Germany); University of Texas Center for Space Research(United States)
institutionsCn: 德国航天中心(德国); 德国航空航天中心 Terra SAR 科学服务系统(德国); 波茨坦亥姆霍兹中心 - GFZ 德国地球科学研究中心(德国); 德克萨斯大学空间研究中心(美国)
contentTypes: Raw data; Scientific and statistical data formats; other
contentTypesCn: 原始数据; 科学和统计数据格式; 其他
description:
TerraSAR-X is a German satellite for Earth Observation, which was launched on July 14, 2007. The mission duration was foreseen to be 5 years. TerraSAR-X carries an innovative high resolution x-band sensor for imaging with resolution up to 1 m.
TerraSAR-X carries as secondary payload an IGOR GPS receiver with GPS RO capability. GFZ provided the IGOR and is responsible for the related TOR experiment (Tracking, Occultation and Ranging). TerraSAR-X provides continuously atmospheric GPS data in near-real time. These data from GFZ are continuously assimilated in parallel with those from GRACE-A by the world-leading weather centers to improve their global forecasts. TerraSAR-X, together with TanDEM-X also forms a twin-satellite constellation for atmosphere sounding and generates an unique data set for the evaluation of the accuracy of the GPS-RO technique.
descriptionCn:
TerraSAR-X是一颗德国地球观测卫星，于2007年7月14日发射。预计任务期限为5年。 TerraSAR-X 搭载创新的高分辨率 x 波段传感器，成像分辨率高达 1 m。
TerraSAR-X 携带具有 GPS RO 功能的 IGOR GPS 接收器作为辅助有效载荷。 GFZ提供IGOR并负责相关TOR实验（跟踪、掩星和测距）。 TerraSAR-X 近乎实时地提供连续的大气 GPS 数据。世界领先的气象中心不断吸收 GFZ 的这些数据与 GRACE-A 的数据，以改进其全球预报。 TerraSAR-X 与 TanDEM-X 一起还形成了用于大气探测的双卫星星座，并生成用于评估 GPS-RO 技术精度的独特数据集。

contentTypesCn: 存档数据; 视听资料; 图片; 纯文本; 源代码; 标准办公文件
description: PANGAEA - Data Publisher for Earth & Environmental Sciences has an almost 30-year history as an open-access library for archiving, publishing, and disseminating georeferenced data from the Earth, environmental, and biodiversity sciences. Originally evolving from a database for sediment cores, it is operated as a joint facility of the Alfred Wegener Institute, Helmholtz Centre for Polar and Marine Research (AWI) and the Center for Marine Environmental Sciences (MARUM) at the University of Bremen. PANGAEA holds a mandate from the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) and is accredited as a World Radiation Monitoring Center (WRMC). It was further accredited as a World Data Center by the International Council for Science (ICS) in 2001 and has been certified with the Core Trust Seal since 2019. The successful cooperation between PANGAEA and the publishing industry along with the correspondent technical implementation enables the cross-referencing of scientific publications and datasets archived as supplements to these publications. PANGAEA is the recommended data repository of numerous international scientific journals.
descriptionCn: PANGEA - 地球与环境科学数据出版商作为一个开放获取图书馆已有近 30 年的历史，用于归档、出版和传播来自地球、环境和生物多样性科学的地理参考数据。它最初是由沉积物核心数据库发展而来，作为阿尔弗雷德·韦格纳研究所、亥姆霍兹极地和海洋研究中心 (AWI) 以及不莱梅大学海洋环境科学中心 (MARUM) 的联合设施运营。 PANGEA 拥有世界气象组织 (WMO) 的授权，并被认可为世界辐射监测中心 (WRMC)。 2001年，PANGEA进一步被国际科学理事会（ICS）认可为世界数据中心，并于2019年获得核心信任印章认证。PANGEA与出版业的成功合作以及相应的技术实施，使跨界数据中心成为可能。 - 引用作为这些出版物的补充而存档的科学出版物和数据集。 PANGEA 是众多国际科学期刊推荐的数据存储库。
